page.title: 07Ryton Heath Farm
page.content: This 64 acre farm which dates from 1735 is reached by a minor road off the main A423.The farm is a small dairy unit with a herd of 40 cattle mainly freisian.The farmer Mr.Thompson does not own a bull but uses the artificial insemination method.The farmer makes his own hay and silage to feed the cattle.His barn can hold 5000 bales of hay and straw the latter he buys in.Silage is made in heavy duty polythene bags instead of a pit.The milking parlour holds only two cows at a time.The farm produces up to 100 gallons of milk a day which is taken to Leicester Co-op.Moles present a problem to a grassland farmer causing untold damage to machinery and silage at hay time Mr. Thompson shoots them. Disposing of the slurry is a problem and under the 1985 act he has had to build a ramp and pit.
